featured.text: As used in the passage, “navigation” clearly means .
I always call out floors very clearly, and I am constantly on the move.
I remember that on my cruise I was required to formally plot our course, using the tide table, even though our goal was an island I could see quite clearly across the water in the distance. 44.
This can be clearly demonstrated by comparing the genes of chimpanzees and those of humans: the difference between them is just about 2 percent. .
As the years have passed by, many of my childhood memories are already ______; I can no longer recall clearly what happened back then.

other.text: To observe the outside world more clearly.

definition.en_def: In a way that is easy to see, hear, or understand.
